intro: Artemisia junatovii, commonly known as the Juniper Artemisia, is a flowering plant in the sunflower family, Asteraceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia, particularly in Kazakhstan and Uzbekistan. This shrub typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring gray-green, aromatic foliage with narrow, silvery leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flower heads that bloom in the summer months. It is well adapted to dry conditions and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
